text: Anisophyllea corneri is a tree of tropical Asia in the family Anisophylleaceae. It is named for the English botanist Edred John Henry Corner. ==Description== Anisophyllea corneri grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . Its bark is smooth. The ellipsoid fruits measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Anisophyllea corneri grows naturally in Peninsular Malaysia and Borneo. Its habitat is lowland mixed dipterocarp to submontane forests from sea-level to altitude. ==References== corneri Category:Trees of Peninsular Malaysia Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1958 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Anisophyllea corneri
